question_text: A bag contains $4$ red balls and $6$ black balls. Two balls are drawn at random without replacement. Find $P(\text{both balls are red})$.
A die is thrown twice. Find $P(\text{sum} = 8 | \text{first throw is even})$.

In a class of $60$ students, $30$ play cricket, $20$ play football and $10$ play both games. A student is selected at random. Find: (i) $P(\text{cricket} | \text{football})$ (ii) $P(\text{exactly one game})$
Two cards are drawn successively without replacement from a well-shuffled pack of $52$ cards. Find $P(\text{both aces} | \text{at least one ace})$.
A box contains $3$ red balls, $4$ white balls and $5$ blue balls. Three balls are drawn at random without replacement. Find $P(\text{all three balls are of different colors})$.
